name: Pydocs
tagline: Various documents relating to radiative transfer and the radative transfer code Python
body:
### Pydocs
**Documents I've used as part of My Phd, relating to Python's implementation of radiative transfer.**

[Adiabatic Cooling (div V derivation)](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/adiab.pdf)

[Adiabatic Cooling (KSL derivation)](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/EnergyLossFromAdiabaticExpansion.pdf)

[H vs O (NSH derivation for Proga model)](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/H_vs_O.pdf)

[Glossary of Ionization Terms](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/ion_glossary.pdf)

**Some documents written by Nick Higginbottom earlier in the project:**

[Radiative Transfer and implementation in Python](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/rad_trans_and_py.pdf)

[Summary of work done in Dec 2010 to incorporate a PL into balance](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/pl_balance_summary.pdf)

[Dielectronic Recombination Notes](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/dr_ion.pdf)

[This is the emailed to Stuart as part of our discussions on ionisation.](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/dr_ion.pdf)

and [Stuart's reply](http://jhmatthews.github.io/pydocs/docs/ss_reply.pdf)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
